description.narrative:
The Coalition Support Programme (CSP) aims to contribute to more accountable governance and to more progressive policy processes and impacts in Vietnam. CSP operates by identifying, fostering and supporting issue-based coalitions for effective advocacy within thepolicy making process. #Coalitions# in this context means multi-stakeholder cooperation among Vietnamese NGOs (VNGOs), state agencies at different levels, media, universities and research institutes, and the private sector. CSP expected to deliver the following outcomes: Improve policies, policy making and monitoring processes via (1) Functioning coalitions ready to act on issues of public concern through effective multi-stakeholder involvement in policy processes, and (2) Strengthening engagement of non-governmental organisations at national and sub-national levels to promote public participation and accountability in law-making and oversight agenda of the National Assembly.
Centre for community and environment (CECR) is a Vietnamese NGO that coordinate the Clean water coalition. Within this project CECR and coalition will do advocacy for 2 policy processes, these are including continuing to advocate the National Assembly to agree including the new law on water pollution control in the new NA legislation agenda period from 2016-2021, andthe second to monitor implementation of portions of the 2014 Environmental Protection Law relating to water pollution in 5 provinces / cities.
For the proposal of the law on water pollution control, the coalition will cooperate with VUSTA and Pollution control department of the Ministry of Natural resource and environment to conduct study and develop the proposal package, which will be used to advocate the ministry and National assembly. The evidence of water pollution and results from community monitoring to prevent andreduce the water pollution at the provincial level are not only good for the water quality at localities, but will also be used as evident for advocacy for the law.

participating-org.narrative: Centre for Environmental and Commun Research

Centre for Environmental and Community Research (CECR) is a Vietnamese non-governmental organization (VNGO) based in Ha Noi. Established in 2009, CECR believes that solutions for present environmental issues need implementing in local areas. These solutions must be developed and adpoted by citizens, resulting in the change in attitude and behaviour of community and individuals towards positive enviroment protection. CECR works with other Clean Water Coalition's members, such as Centre for Environment and Community Development (CECoD), Tây B#c University. Oxfam partly funds and supports in technical aspect for Clean Water Coalition. CECR represents Clean Water Coalition to receive fund and register with relating authorities.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
